column4: I don't want to step on toes, but I had a linux question. Is there a protocol to getting help here?
!ask ?
:) thats the protocol
the whole question about snippets ::: best chances of having someone who knows answer
this "date" file is just a sample that came with the program?
did you try reinstalling the program so you get the file back?
why not reinstall?
if you're concerned about that, you could try copying the configuration files (though i don't think reinstalling would overwrite them)
check this --> ls -al | grep snippits
or just ls -al if you want to spot it yourself
ok, i see it... now what
also .... did you just move the date file but don't know where it is?
is there a file or folder DOTsnippits
no, I said --> rm ~/.snippits/date
ok , so it's gone.   copy that configuration file somewhere, like cp .snippits snippitsbackup
don't put a dot in front of the backup , and it wont be a hidden file
you may get an error if its a folder and not a file... if you do, replace cp with cp -r
this, btw is almost definitely unnecessary, but since you're afraid to lose the configuration, might as well copy
Thanks. it copied fine with cp -r
I'll try reinstalling
after you double check that the copy is there, look around to see any other snippits stuff, though i doubt -- copy if you find any and reinstall
the DOTfiles in your home are personal settings for your programs, and are hidden by default so they don't get in your way....
the install worked, and "cp date ~/.snippits/date" from the recreated example file worked fine. Now I can say 14-Feb-08 _so_ easily!!! Thank you for the help.
np
